ai.summary: Boundary Patrol is a demanding 22.1 km hike in the UK, designed for experienced hikers. Expect rugged terrain, variable weather, and significant elevation changes that test endurance and navigation skills.
ai.terrain_summary: The route covers varied terrain including open moorland, long ascents and descents, rocky sections, and muddy footpaths. In exposed stretches you can encounter wind and rain; navigation can be challenging in less-tracked areas.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for UK weather and limited shelter: carry a detailed map and compass (GPS is helpful but not a substitute), know the route, and check the forecast. Wear sturdy boots and dress in layers, bring waterproofs, food, water, a first aid kit, headlamp, and a whistle. Start early to maximize daylight, tell someone your plan, and be prepared to turn back if conditions deteriorate. In remote sections, mobile signal may be unreliable.
recommended_gear: Lightweight emergency bivy or space blanket
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly March–October)

seo.title: Boundary Patrol: 22.1 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Boundary Patrol, a challenging 22.1 km hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear recommendations, and the best seasons for this demanding route.
